snippet: Thanks to its crack-smoking mayor, a city becomes a spectacle.
abstract: Op-Ed article by novelist Stephen Marche holds Toronto Mayor Rob Ford's continuing popularity, despite his admission that he has smoked crack cocaine, speaks to deep currents of outsider rage in the city; contends Toronto is the city of Rob Ford now, an expanding hot mess fueled by dark secrets, inarticulate desires and inchoate fury.
lead_paragraph: Thanks to its crack-smoking mayor, a city becomes a spectacle.

headline.seo: What Mayor Rob Ford Knows About Toronto
